00001 /**
00002     @file
00003     simplemsp - an MSP object shell
00004     jeremy bernstein - jeremy@bootsquad.com 
00005 
00006     @ingroup    examples    
00007 */
00008 
00009 #include "ext.h"                            // standard Max include, always required (except in Jitter)
00010 #include "ext_obex.h"                       // required for new style objects
00011 #include "z_dsp.h"                          // required for MSP objects
00012 
00013 ////////////////////////// object struct
00014 typedef struct _simplemsp 
00015 {
00016     t_pxobject                  ob;         // the object itself (t_pxobject in MSP)
00017     float                       offset; 
00018 } t_simplemsp;
00019 
00020 ///////////////////////// function prototypes
00021 //// standard set
00022 void *simplemsp_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00023 void simplemsp_free(t_simplemsp *x);
00024 void simplemsp_assist(t_simplemsp *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00025 
00026 void simplemsp_float(t_simplemsp *x, double f);
00027 
00028 void simplemsp_dsp(t_simplemsp *x, t_signal **sp, short *count);
00029 t_int *simplemsp_perform(t_int *w);
00030 //////////////////////// global class pointer variable
00031 void *simplemsp_class;
00032 
00033 
00034 int main(void)
00035 {   
00036     // object initialization, note the use of dsp_free for the freemethod, which is required
00037     // unless you need to free allocated memory, in which case you should call dsp_free from
00038     // your custom free function.
00039 
00040     // OLD METHOD
00041     // setup((t_messlist **)&simplemsp_class, (method)simplemsp_new, (method)dsp_free, (short)sizeof(t_simplemsp), 0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00042     // addfloat((method)simplemsp_float);
00043     // you need this
00044     // addmess((method)simplemsp_dsp,               "dsp",          A_CANT, 0);
00045     // addmess((method)simplemsp_assist,            "assist",       A_CANT, 0);  
00046     // you need this
00047     // dsp_initclass();
00048     
00049     // NEW METHOD
00050     t_class *c;
00051     
00052     c = class_new("simplemsp~", (method)simplemsp_new, (method)dsp_free, (long)sizeof(t_simplemsp), 0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00053     
00054     class_addmethod(c, (method)simplemsp_float,     "float",    A_FLOAT, 0);
00055     class_addmethod(c, (method)simplemsp_dsp,       "dsp",      A_CANT, 0);
00056     class_addmethod(c, (method)simplemsp_assist,    "assist",   A_CANT, 0);
00057     
00058     class_register(CLASS_BOX, c); // register class as a box class
00059     
00060     class_dspinit(c); // new style object version of dsp_initclass();
00061     simplemsp_class = c;
00062     
00063     return 0;
00064 }
00065 
00066 void simplemsp_float(t_simplemsp *x, double f)
00067 {
00068     x->offset = f;
00069 }
00070 
00071 // this function is called when the DAC is enabled, and "registers" a function
00072 // for the signal chain. in this case, "simplemsp_perform"
00073 void simplemsp_dsp(t_simplemsp *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00074 {
00075     post("my sample rate is: %f", sp[0]->s_sr);
00076     
00077     // dsp_add
00078     // 1: (t_perfroutine p) perform method
00079     // 2: (long argc) number of args to your perform method
00080     // 3...: argc additional arguments, all must be sizeof(pointer) or long
00081     // these can be whatever, so you might want to include your object pointer in there
00082     // so that you have access to the info, if you need it.
00083     dsp_add(simplemsp_perform, 4, x, sp[0]->s_vec, sp[1]->s_vec, sp[0]->s_n);
00084 }
00085 
00086 t_int *simplemsp_perform(t_int *w)
00087 {
00088     // DO NOT CALL post IN HERE, but you can call defer_low (not defer)
00089     
00090     // args are in a vector, sized as specified in simplemsp_dsp method
00091     // w[0] contains &simplemsp_perform, so we start at w[1]
00092     t_simplemsp *x = (t_simplemsp *)(w[1]);
00093     t_float *inL = (t_float *)(w[2]);
00094     t_float *outL = (t_float *)(w[3]);
00095     int n = (int)w[4];
00096     
00097     // this perform method simply copies the input to the output
00098     while (n--)
00099         *outL++ = *inL++ + x->offset;
00100         
00101     // you have to return the NEXT pointer in the array OR MAX WILL CRASH
00102     return w + 5;
00103 }
00104 
00105 void simplemsp_assist(t_simplemsp *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00106 {
00107     if (m == ASSIST_INLET) { //inlet
00108         sprintf(s, "I am inlet %ld", a);
00109     } 
00110     else {  // outlet
00111         sprintf(s, "I am outlet %ld", a);           
00112     }
00113 }
00114 
00115 // NOT CALLED!, we use dsp_free for a generic free function
00116 void simplemsp_free(t_simplemsp *x) 
00117 {
00118     ;
00119 }
00120 
00121 void *simplemsp_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00122 {
00123     t_simplemsp *x = NULL;
00124 
00125     // OLD VERSION
00126     // if (x = (t_simplemsp *)newobject(simplemsp_class)) {
00127     
00128     // NEW VERSION
00129     if (x = (t_simplemsp *)object_alloc(simplemsp_class)) {
00130         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);  // MSP inlets: arg is # of inlets and is REQUIRED! 
00131                                         // use 0 if you don't need inlets
00132         outlet_new(x, "signal"); // signal outlet (note "signal" rather than NULL)
00133         x->offset = 0.;
00134     }
00135     return (x);
00136 }
